gw.api.graph.traverse

Interface TraversalStrategy<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BreadthFirstTraversal, DepthFirstTraversal, TraversalStrategyBase

    public interface TraversalStrategy<T>
    Specifies a strategy for how the graph is traversed, specifically the order in which edges/nodes are traversed.
    Author:
    bspies

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEdgeForTraversal(Edge<T> edge)
      Method to be called during graph traversal to add an edge that needs to be traversed.
      void addOutgoingEdges(T node)
      Method to be called when visiting a node in order to add all (potentially filtered) outgoing edges.
      Edge<T> getNext()
      Gets (and consumes) the next edge to be traversed.
      boolean hasNext()
      Is there another edge to process?

    • Method Detail

      • addOutgoingEdges

        void addOutgoingEdges(T node)
        Method to be called when visiting a node in order to add all (potentially filtered) outgoing edges.
        Parameters:
        node - The currently visited node

      • addEdgeForTraversal

        void addEdgeForTraversal(Edge<T> edge)
        Method to be called during graph traversal to add an edge that needs to be traversed.
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge that needs to be traversed

      • getNext

        Edge<T> getNext()
        Gets (and consumes) the next edge to be traversed.
        Returns:
        The next edge

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()
        Is there another edge to process?
        Returns:
        True if there are more edges to traverse
